basics.name: Kalki Rose
basics.label: Cloud and Data Expert | Technical Account Lead | Supervisor
basics.summary:
Driven by a passion for technology that began with my first computer, equipped with 5 1/4' floppy disks (you know the ones that were actually bendy), I have spent the past 20 years honing my skills and expertise in the ever-evolving world of cloud and data platforms. My dedication to lifelong learning and continuous professional development has allowed me to collaborate with exceptional individuals across various industries, shaping my approach and expanding my capabilities with every new challenge.

As a supervisor and manager, I have found immense fulfillment in empowering those I work with, fostering their growth, and contributing to their success. As a key member of the leadership team, I have been instrumental in devising strategies, driving innovation, and facilitating the adoption of cutting-edge cloud and data solutions.

As a wise person I worked with once said, at the core all problems are people problems.

I am a continious learner, both in technology and life, and recently became a certified scuba diving instructor!

work.name: Futurice
work.summary: During my four years at Futurice, I was promoted several times, and held multiple concurrent roles, as seen below.

work.name: Futurice
work.position: Cloud and Data Platforms Expertise Lead
highlights: Co-development of the internal cloud and data playbook.
Co-development of the internal center for learning cloud and data certification program.
Market Research, Gap analysis, and Risk Analysis for emerging technologies leading to strategic investment in go-to-market products and services, internal upskilling, and recruitment strategy.
Part of the leadership team supporting the company re-organisation from a matrix structure to something similar to Holacracy
work.summary: Futurice had five pillars that were the foundation of our company structure, as well as our go-to-market strategy. I was the lead for the Cloud and Data Platforms pillar.

work.name: Futurice
highlights: Used a data mesh approach to develop an architecture to aggregate 20 disparate data scources from on-premise, cloud storage, and streaming over the air sources to enable data analytics to feed insights to R&D, Sales, Engineering, and Marketing. A key focus was put on cost, security, and reliability
Developed and ran a series of classes to upskill client technical engineers in cloud and data best practices
Developed and ran a series of classes to upskill internal technologists in cloud and data best practices
Supported 30 people across 6 cross functional teams of developers, designers, and data scientists as a cloud architect with projects ranging from tens to hundreds of millions of euros
Developed an architecture for a digital onboard vehicle instruction manual
Worked in a team documenting reusable cloud architecture components for internal project use
Worked with client to bring a cultural shift towards cloud and data solutions in a primarily physical automotive company
work.summary: As a senior cloud architect I was focused primarily in AWS, supporting both our internal initiatives as well as supporting our clients in their migration to cloud technologies, both at a technical level and at a cultural level.

work.name: Futurice
highlights: Setting of account OKR's in line with country and global OKR's
Oversaw up to 30 people working in six concurrent agile teams
Responsible for project budgeting, forecasting, burn downs, project health, and overall project delivery and success
Responsible for project discovery, requirements gathering, proposal writing, pitching, estimations, and contract negotiation
Participated in all project kickoffs, and remained as a technical cloud expert across all projects
First line of escalation for conflict resolution
Supported client initiatives for driving cultural change in the direction of innovation and emerging technologies
Responsible for onboarding new project teams with a specific focus on account and security requirements and best practices
work.summary: I was the technical account lead for one of our major accounts with a leading automotive company. This role was focused on client relationship building, as well as supporting our teams on a technical level as well as a well-being level.

work.name: Futurice
highlights: Supervisor for 6 technologists and data scientists up to expert level, mentor for 3 technologists
Supported supervisees in career path planning and short term and long term SMART goals
Responsible for recommendations for career advancement of my own supervisees and part of the descision comittee for career level changes for all employees in Germany
Applied servant leadership to support my supervisees on a daily basis, for advice, challenging ideas, and conflict resolution
Responsible for early caring, well-being, stress management, and work saftey for my supervisees
work.summary:
As a supervisor at Futurice, a core part of my philosophy was to build trusting and caring relationships.

This has developed through communications training with [GreenElephant](https://greenelephant.org/), internal training in non-violent communication, and taking inspiration from leaders such as Kim Scott (Radical Candor) and Bren√© Brown (Dare to Lead). I love feedback and am continually adapting and evolving my approach so as best to meet the needs of each of the individuals that I oversee. Being able to support my supervisees and see them evolve and progress in their careers has been one of the most fullfilling experiences I have had so far.

work.name: Futurice
highlights: Developed the core backend system based on the Hexagonal paradigm and a microservice architecture
Developed the message queue microservices for doing event driven processing
Wrote re-usable components for all parts of the system
Wrote and deployed docker files for many of the services
Primary point of contact for the client PO in collaboration with our internal Scrum Master
Facilitated group estimation using party poker
Facilitated group discovery and creation of development tasks
Configured Jira to fit our exact project requirements in a cross functional team, with multiple boards and multiple board types, across three horizons of delivery (sprints, short term, long term)
Coached the developer below me over 6 months to take over my role
work.summary:
I was lead developer for a multi-year multi-million euro project for a leading automotive company.
The core technology stack was React and Typescript on the front end, GraphQL for the front end API layer, REST for the backend API layer, NodeJs for the core backend services, and Clojure for some of the additional microservices used to load Java data analytics libraries. Testing was done with Jest and Cypress, and the entire system was deployed using Docker and Openshift (RedHat K8s).

work.name: Amber Road
highlights: Requirements gathering and proposal writing
Implementing custom client changes to core software
Environment initialisation, onsite deployment, and client training
Training new staff members
work.summary: Amber road built software to support multi-national companies with supply chain logisitics, import/export tarrifs, restricted screen lists, and product management.

work.name: Revelian
highlights: Developed the front end for a new video conferencing software using AngularJS, Flash and Twitter Bootstrap
Supported the migration from the legacy Cold Fusion tech stack into a modern Java based micro-services architecture hosted on AWS
work.summary: Revelian developed solutions to assist in talent aquisition, with a focus on psychometrics. These came in the form of assessments, quiz's, skill checklists, and interactive games.

work.name: JuniorCru
highlights: Responsible for requirements gathering, proposal writing, estimation, project management and delivery
Responsible for full project lifecycle. Development, testing, deployment, and maintenance
Tech lead and lead developer for projects with Virgin Australia, Corporate Realestate Australia, Careers Australia, and a number of smaller initiatives
work.summary:
JuniorCru was a web development consultancy primarily in the field of eCommerce and brochure-ware websites.
The core tech stack was PHP with Wordpress, AngularJS, Less, AWS, MySQL, with Jira and Confluence for project management.

work.name: Kintek Web Devlopment
highlights: Responsible for project specification, scoping, documentation and management
Full project lifecycle: development, domain registration, deployment, testing, maintenance
work.summary: Kintek was a small family run web development agency focused on developing bespoke eCommerce solutions, web applications, and mobile applications.

volunteer.summary:
Unusual Pioneers is a pioneering platform for corporate leaders and social intrapreneurs turning business into a force for good. We support the work of social intrapreneurs through mentoring, peer-to-peer support, and involvement of executives across industries. 

Learn more on unusualpioneers.com

certificates.name: Amazon Web Services Solutions Architect - Professional
Amazon Web Services DevOps Engineer - Professional
Amazon Web Services Data Analytics (formerly Big Data) Specialty

references.name: üë©‚Äçüíª Leilei Ouyang üêò
references.reference:
Kalki has been an encouraging, inspiring and empathetic supervisor during my time at Futurice. He encourages me to learn and experiment with different technologies, inspires me to expand my skill set and take on new challenges, and provides me valuable guidance on career progression. 

Kalki possesses a humble and participative leadership style through active listening, comprehensive analysis, constructive escalation and productive problem-solving which make him an empathetic leader as well as an outstanding team player.
